messages.subject: Popping up out of Lurkdom
messages.msgSnippet: No, I haven t been snubbing this list, just have problems with my ISP.  I can t respond to the messages from my mail (keep getting something about I can t
messages.messageBody:
No, I haven't been snubbing this list, just have problems with my
ISP. I can't respond to the messages from my mail (keep getting
something about I can't reply to yahoogroups from my location that I
need to connect to Bellsouth - and I'm on a Bellsouth DSL line - so
go figure. Bellsouth can't figure it out) So I went no mail
thinking I would just read and respond from yahoogroups. You
became "out of sight out of mind" because you ended up filing on the
second page. Sorry!! :-)

We've had a great winter so far. Keon (my 6yo) has had a store run
in our house. It was great fun. He was stealing our things and
selling them back to us (at varying prices). WE even had to
purchase kleenex from him (at 5¢ a piece). He made around $5 in 2.5
days of business. Today he is having a "going out of business sale"
and I think I am going to do a buy out after his sisters have
finished shopping. He has enjoyed his whole game of setting up
shop, having a sale, making transactions and change, writing out
reciepts in case you want to exchange something (no; he won't refund
your money on used kleenex - I tried LOL!), having store hours,
taking breaks, creating an "employees lounge" (which I'm not allowed
to be in because I am not an employee) paying his employees (he's
been paying his sisters 25¢ a day to keep watch over his store when
he has taken bathroom breaks and lunch breaks. I've loved watching
him be so serious in his endeavor.

Anyway, maybe now I will remember to check page 2 for messages LOL!

Michelle
